attributes.trait_type: short-grain rice, soaked overnight, rinsed, and drained
garlic, separated into cloves but not peeled

attributes.value:
Instructions:

Prepare the Cabbage:

Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Remove the core from the cabbage. Submerge the cabbage head in boiling water until the leaves soften, about 5-10 minutes. Remove leaves with tongs as they become pliable.
Place the softened leaves in an ice bath to stop the cooking process, then drain.
Trim the thick veins from the leaves.

Prepare the Filling:

In a skillet, heat the olive oil and sauté the ground meat with the spices (allspice, cumin, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, pepper) until browned. Allow to cool slightly.
Mix the sautéed meat with the drained rice and crushed garlic in a large bowl.

Stuff the Cabbage Leaves:

Place a tablespoon of the filling at the base of each cabbage leaf.
Roll the leaf tightly, folding in the sides like a burrito to encase the filling.

Assemble the Dish:

Layer the bottom of a large pot with the tougher outer cabbage leaves.
Place the stuffed cabbage rolls seam-side down in the pot, tightly packed in layers.
Scatter the unpeeled garlic cloves between the layers.
Pour the seasoned broth (and tomato puree if using) over the cabbage rolls until just covered.

Cook:

Place a heatproof plate on top of the rolls to keep them submerged.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour, until the cabbage is tender.

Serve:

Remove the plate and carefully transfer the rolls to a serving platter.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the rolls and serve with lemon slices and plain yogurt on the side.
